intro: Melampyrum setaceum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and pairs of opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers clustered in terminal racemes, which bloom in late summer. It is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. This variety is distinguished by its broader leaves compared to the typical form of Melampyrum setaceum.
